meanings.definition: Lack of success or efficiency in achieving a desired result.
meanings.sent1: The team's ineffectiveness in scoring goals cost them the match.
meanings.sent2: The ineffectiveness of the new cleaning product was disappointing.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to have an ineffectiveness spell on it.
meanings.sent4: The student's constant distractions led to an ineffectiveness in studying.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the cave highlighted the ineffectiveness of the flashlight.

meanings.definition: The state of being ineffective or not producing the intended outcome.
meanings.sent1: The company's financial ineffectiveness led to its closure.
meanings.sent2: She felt frustrated by the ineffectiveness of her efforts to fix the leak.
meanings.sent3: The clown's attempt at juggling showed an amusing ineffectiveness.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises revealed an ineffectiveness in delivering results.
meanings.sent5: The rust on the old lock contributed to its ineffectiveness in securing the door.
